data: For practice guidelines, refer to Decision Support Tool (DST): Treatment of Hypoxemia
q1h x 4 , then q4h or per prescriber orders and PRN. Heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature and WoB
q1h x4, then q4h or per prescriber orders or PRN
q1h x 4, then q4h or per prescriber orders or PRN
Do not give oxygen if the SPO2 is greater than or equal to 92%

Indication: 
- SpO2 less than 92% or per patient baseline
Initiate the minimal amount of oxygen necessary to reverse signs / symptoms of hypoxia
Routine, Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater, nasal Cannula, 0 - 4 L/min. NIA for Treatment of Hypoxemia
Routine, Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater, Simple Mask, 6 - 10 L/min. NIA for Treatment of Hypoxemia
Urgent, Reason for Consulte: Acute respiratory distress and has nasal cannula at maximum flow for age
When oxygen therapy is initiated to establish ongoing oxygen therapy and management. Provider to assess patient within 30 minutes
